attributes.action: scrap the rules that reduce peoples entitlement to incapacity benefit because they have funded a private or final salary pension fund
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I retired through ill health in Feb 2006. I appplied legitimately for incapacity benefit but had 50% of any amount over £85.00 per week taken from me because I had income from a pension fund that I had paid for voluntarily. This is in effect penalising me for having made private personal pension provision.The government actually give me only £8.00 per week IB despite me having paid National Insurance contributions well above this amount for 39 years. This is a disgrace.I thought I had paid National Insurance contributions to insure me against sickness later in life.Not so. Last year 300,200 people had their IB reduced because of this unfair rule.
